docs.text: scarface , a remake of the 1932 film of the same name , is a very gripping and , as far as i know , a true-to-life story of how power and violence lead to corruption .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: al pacino , as tony montana ( for whom the movie is named ) , also provides a brilliant performance as a cuban refugee who comes to america with less than nothing and becomes one of the most highly respected and feared drug lords in miami .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: oliver stone also penned the screenplay in one of his earlier writing roles .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film begins by disclosing the story of now fidel castro ordered thousands of cubans to set sail and head for the coasts of the united states .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: many of these cubans had criminal records , such as tony montana , a cocky , fast-talking man who has the look of crime .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nearly right after his arrival in miami , tony is thrust into the gangster life when he participates in a cocaine buy that goes awry .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: along with his friend and partner , manolo ( steven bauer ) , tony rises in the gangster ranks when he forms a friendship with frank lopez ( robert loggia ) , a high-roller in the organized crime field .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tony also begins to fall in love with elvira ( michelle pfeiffer ) , who at the time was frank's lover .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of course , sooner or later in this industry , betrayal and corruption amount into a force greater than anything else , and tony is one of the ones who fall victim to this force .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is not before he becomes one of the most respected , and often feared , men in miami .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tony gets to the point where he cannot trust anyone , and everyone he knows basically feels the same way towards him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no one can trust him , and basically , no one does .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: scarface , although incredibly violent , is one of the best crime films of its time and stands out as another great performance for al pacino .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although he did not receive any recognition from the academy for his performance , it truly is a very good one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , his accent and facial movements alone are enough in my mind to win at least a nomination ( although he did get a golden globe nomination ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another element that stands out when someone mentions this film is the profanity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a figure tagged to the film boasts that the word " fuck " and it's uses are uttered 206 times throughout the film , which is apparently a record .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the thing is , the vulgarity fits rather well with the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as odd as it sounds , it's true .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the end , scarface is a very powerful film that hits home hard .
docs.label: positive
